mainBoard.name: Flesh Reaver
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever Flesh Reaver successfully deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals an equal amount of damage to you.

rulings.text: Flesh Reaver’s ability triggers whenever it deals any damage to a creature or opponent, not only combat damage.

mainBoard.text: Whenever Flesh Reaver deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals that much damage to you.

mainBoard.originalText: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: Prevent all damage to a creature or player from one source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The answer to life should never be death; it should always be more life, wrapped tight around us like precious silks."

rulings.text: It only returns to owner's hand if it is still on the battlefield at end of combat.

Defender (This creature can't attack.)

—Serra

mainBoard.name: Disenchant
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

Cycling o2 (You may pay o2 and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

mainBoard.text:

mainBoard.flavorText:
"It is not your place to rule, Radiant. It may not even be mine."
—Serra

foreignData.name: Bescheidenheit
foreignData.text: Eine Kreatur Deiner Wahl verliert alle ihre Fähigkeiten und wird zu einer 0/1 Kreatur bis zum Ende des Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Humble
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature loses all abilities and is a 0/1 creature until end of turn.

rulings.text: Effects that modify a creature’s power and/or toughness, such as the effect of Seal of Strength, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch its power and toughness.

Humble doesn’t counter abilities that have already triggered or been activated. In particular, casting this spell won’t stop a creature’s ability that says “At the beginning of your upkeep,” “When this creature enters the battlefield,” or similar from triggering.

Humble overwrites all previous effects that set the creature’s base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after Humble resolves will overwrite this effect.
If the affected creature gains an ability after Humble resolves, it will keep that ability.

mainBoard.text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and has base power and toughness 0/1.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"The land putrefied at its touch, turned into an oily bile in seconds."
—Radiant, archangel

foreignData.name: Entwürdigung
foreignData.text: Zerstöre ein Land oder eine nichtschwarze Kreatur deiner Wahl. Eine Kreatur, die auf diese Art zerstört wird, kann in diesem Zug nicht regeneriert .

mainBoard.name: Befoul
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. A creature destroyed this way cannot be regenerated this turn.

rulings.text: This is not modal. You do not have to choose the target type. The target has to either be a land or non-black creature when announced and on resolution.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

mainBoard.flavorText: Yawgmoth brushed Urza's mind, and Urza's world convulsed.

foreignData.name: Korruption
foreignData.text: Die Korruption fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl Schadenspunkte in der Höhe der Anzahl der Sümpfe, die Du kontrollierst, zu. Wenn die Korruption einem Spieler oder einer Kreatur erfolgreich Schaden zufügt, erhältst Du Lebenspunkte in Höhe dieser Schadenspunkte dazu.

mainBoard.name: Corrupt
mainBoard.originalText: Corrupt deals 1 damage to target creature or player for each swamp you control. When Corrupt successfully deals damage to a creature or player, gain life equal to that damage.

rulings.text: The swamps are counted on resolution.

The amount of damage dealt to a creature is not bounded by its toughness, and the amount of damage dealt to a player is not bounded by that player's life total. For example, if Corrupt deals 6 damage to a 2/2 creature, you'll gain 6 life.
The life you gain is equal to the damage dealt by Corrupt, not necessarily to the number of Swamps you control (if some or all of the damage is prevented, for example).
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.
Corrupt counts any land you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

mainBoard.text: Corrupt deals damage to any target equal to the number of Swamps you control. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

foreignData.name: Opal-Akrolith
foreignData.text:
Wenn einer Deiner Gegner erfolgreich einen Kreaturenzauber spricht und der Opal-Akrolith eine Verzauberung ist, wird der Opal-Akrolith zu einer 2/4 Kreatur, die als Wächter zählt.
0: Der Opal-Akrolith wird zu einer Verzauberung.

mainBoard.name: Opal Acrolith
mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever one of your opponents successfully casts a creature spell, if Opal Acrolith is an enchantment, Opal Acrolith becomes a 2/4 creature that counts as a Guardian.
o0: Opal Acrolith becomes an enchantment.

rulings.text: Changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
It triggers when the spell is cast, which means it becomes a creature before that spell resolves.
When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
When it turns into an enchantment, it is no longer a creature.
A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Acrolith is an enchantment, Opal Acrolith becomes a 2/4 Soldier creature.
{0}: Opal Acrolith becomes an enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: "It is *not* sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."

foreignData.name: Pariah
foreignData.text: Leite alle Schadenspunkte, die Dir zugefügt werden, auf die verzauberte Kreatur um.

mainBoard.name: Pariah
mainBoard.originalText: Redirect to enchanted creature all damage dealt to you.

rulings.text: If you control multiple Pariahs enchanting different creatures, you choose which redirection effect to apply. You can't divide damage dealt by one source or combat damage dealt by multiple creatures simultaneously. For example, if a spell would deal 6 damage to you and you control multiple Pariahs, you may have that 6 damage dealt to either of the enchanted creatures instead, but you can't choose to have 3 damage dealt to each one.
If you would be dealt combat damage, the damage dealt to the enchanted creature instead is still combat damage.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

foreignData.name: Der Schwarze Tod
foreignData.text:
Opfer den Schwarzen Tod, wenn am Ende eines Zuges keine Kreaturen im Spiel sind.
{B}:Der Schwarze Tod fügt jeder Kreatur und jedem Spieler 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

mainBoard.name: Pestilence
mainBoard.originalText:
At the end of each turn, if no creatures are in play, sacrifice Pestilence.
oo
B Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

mainBoard.name: Rune of Protection: Black
mainBoard.originalText:
oo
W Prevent all damage to you from a black source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)
Cycling o2 (You may pay o2 and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

mainBoard.text:
{W}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Urza dared to attack Phyrexia. Slowly, it retaliated.

Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

foreignData.name: Anbetung
foreignData.text: Jeglicher Schaden, der eigentlich Deine Lebenspunkte unter 1 reduzieren würde, reduziert sie stattdessen auf 1, falls Du eine Kreatur kontrollierst.

mainBoard.name: Worship
mainBoard.originalText: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 instead reduces it to 1 if you control a creature.

rulings.text: It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.

Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

mainBoard.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Tawnos's blueprints were critical to the creation of my armor. As he once sealed himself in steel, I sealed myself in a walking crypt."
—Urza

foreignData.name: Urzas Rüstung
foreignData.text: Immer wenn Dir eine Quelle Schaden zufügt, wird dieser Schaden um 1 reduziert.

mainBoard.name: Urza's Armor
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever a source deals damage to you, that damage is reduced by 1.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect, and prevent the 1 damage to you only.
It is a prevention effect applied when damage would be dealt.

mainBoard.text: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
